Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Joao Moutinho was out at third."
A: no
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Neymar Jr. made a pick in the paint."
A: yes
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Pau Gasol made a pick in the paint."
A: yes
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Neymar Jr. made a pick in the paint and Pau Gasol made a pick in the paint on the same play."
A: no
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Neymar Jr. made a pick in the paint and Pau Gasol made a pick in the paint on different plays."

Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Neymar Jr. made a pick in the paint and Pau Gasol made a pick in the paint on the same play in a game where both play for the same team."

Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Neymar Jr. made a pick in the paint and Pau Gasol made a pick in the paint on different plays in a game where both play for the same team."
A: yes
Q: Is the following sentence plausible? "Neymar Jr. made a pick in the paint and Pau Gasol made a pick in the paint on the same play in a game where both play for different teams."
A: no
